landing.title: SUSE OpenStack Cloud Upgrade
landing.description: In order to upgrade SUSE OpenStack Cloud from version 6 to 7, the following requirements must be met:

requirements.point1: The Administration Server needs to have the latest SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6 updates installed. One of these updates will add the new upgrade routine to the Crowbar Web interface.
requirements.point2: All other nodes need to have the latest SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6 updates and the latest SLES updates.
requirements.point3: All allocated nodes need to be available. In addition, a free node with at least an equal amount of disk and memory space as the largest running node must be free of any workload and available.

landing.note: Note: Manual changes to the cloud during the upgrade process could lead to irrepairable damage to the cloud, the workloads running in it and the data they produce or consume.

backup.description: Create a backup of the Administration Server configuration and download it in your browser. Keep this backup somewhere safe in case of emergency. With this backup and a fresh deployment of SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6 your cloud can be returned to itâ€™s previous state.

admin-repository-checks.title: Upgrading to SUSE OpenStack Cloud 7 requires software repositories for SLES12 SP2 and SUSE OpenStack Cloud 7.
admin-repository-checks.description: Update the URLs of the following software repositories and click 'Check' to verify the repositories are available. When all repositories have been verified click on 'Next' to proceed.

upgrade-admin.title: Upgrade the Administration Server
upgrade-admin.description: The button 'Upgrade Administration Server' begins the update and upgrade process of the administration server. The SLES 12 SP1 operating system of the administration server will be upgraded to SLES 12 SP2. This might take up to half an hour so please be patient.

nodes-repository-checks.description: Please update the repository information on the CEPH and HA add-on products as well as the SUSE OpenStack Cloud 7 and SLES12 SP2 repositories used by the compute plane.
